page.title: 13Church and Chapel
page.content: {PLUMPTON CHURCH The Vicar of Weedon Lois, Wappenham & Moreton Pinkney has the right to use Plumpton Church twice a year on dates agreed by the Dioscese (at present 24 June & Harvest Festival); also it can be used for special occasions, ie: Christenings, by permission of the oc- cupants of the Old Rectory, who main- tain the Church & churchyard. {WESTON BAPTIST CHAPEL} Built in 1780 at a cost of Â£250 for site & buildings, Weston Chapel serves 15 villages at present. Every Sunday, Morning Service is taken by the Minister who lives in Weston. Usually 40 adults & 30 chldren attend. The venue for evening service rotates be- tween 3 chapels. In August 1985, 4 adults are being baptised by total im- mersion at Evening Service in Weston; this takes place about every 2 years.
